subject: Entrepreneurship
subcategory: Business Models That Changed the World
title: The Rise of Platform Business Models
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rise of Platform Business Models.

hook.text: In 2007 Nokia was the world's most valuable phone company. By 2013, platforms had eaten it alive.

buildup.text: A platform connects producers and consumers. It doesn't make the productâ€”it makes the connection.

discovery.text: Uber owns no cars. Airbnb owns no hotels. Facebook creates no content. They're all platforms.

twist.text: Traditional companies create value in a pipeline. Platforms let others create value for them.

climax.text: Seven of the ten most valuable companies in the world are now platform businesses.

punchline.text: The biggest hotel chain owns no rooms.

quiz.question: What makes a platform business model different from traditional businesses?
options: It connects producers and consumers instead of making the product itself
It always offers free products to users
It requires massive upfront inventory investment
